question.text: Which one of the following statements is incorrect about menstruation?

options.text: At menopause in the female, there is especially abrupt increase in gonadotropic hormones
The beginning of the cycle of menstruation is called menarche
During normal menstruction about 40 ml blood is lost
The menstrual fluid can easily clot

solution.text:
Normal menstrual blood does clot, menstrual blood contains not only blood but also tissue from the lining of the uterus.
The female body typically releases anticoagulants to keep menstrual blood from clotting as it's being released. But when the period is heavy and blood is being rapidly expelled, there's not enough time for anticoagulants to work. That enables clots to form.
